Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='BR98')

BibliographicData.Title: Organization of direct hippocampal efferent projections to the cerebral cortex of the rhesus monkey: Projections from CA1, prosubiculum, and subiculum to the temporal lobe

BrainSite.FullName: Intraparietal sulcus associated area in the superior temporal sulcus
Lateral basal nucleus of the amygdala
Medial basal nucleus of the amygdala
Temporal parietooccipital associated area in superior temporal sulcus

"To understand the overall direct hippocampal projections to the temporal lobe, tritiated amino acid injections were made into different parts of the HF in one hemisphere in each of 18 rhesus monkeys. The injection sites from ten cases showing temporal projections are mapped on a flattened reconstruction of the HF in Figure 3A. These positive injections covered different rostrocaudal levels of CA1´, CA1, prosubiculum, and subiculum. In some of these cases, the injections also involved the overlapping DG, CA4, or CA3 subfields, but this is not illustrated on this two-dimensional map, because, in the other eight cases, in which the isotope injections were limited to parts of the DG, CA4, CA3, or CA2 subfields, no temporal lobe cortical projections were observed." (p. 97)

The injection sites from ten cases showing temporal projections are mapped on a flattened reconstruction of the HF in Figure 3A. These positive injections covered different rostrocaudal levels of CA1´, CA1, prosubiculum, and subiculum. In some of these cases, the injections also involved the overlapping DG, CA4, or CA3 subfields, but this is not illustrated on this two-dimensional map, because, in the other eight cases, in which the isotope injections were limited to parts of the DG, CA4, CA3, or CA2 subfields, no temporal lobe cortical projections were observed." (p. 97)

These positive injections covered different rostrocaudal levels of CA1´, CA1, prosubiculum, and subiculum. In some of these cases, the injections also involved the overlapping DG, CA4, or CA3 subfields, but this is not illustrated on this two-dimensional map, because, in the other eight cases, in which the isotope injections were limited to parts of the DG, CA4, CA3, or CA2 subfields, no temporal lobe cortical projections were observed." (p. 97)

" Results from the five additional anterograde cases confirmed the projections described in detail in the above cases. For example, in case MLP-L, an injection of 50 [micro] Ci of tritiated amino acids was centered in the distal one-third of CA1 and prosubiculum at the midbody level of the HF (Fig. 3A). " (p. 100)

" In case MMH-R, an injection of approximately 15 [micro] Ci was centered in proximal CA1 and adjacent CA2 at the midbody level of the HF, just proximal to the injection site from case MPG-R. " (p. 99)
" In case MNQ-R, an injection of approximately 15-20 [micro] Ci of tritiated amino acids was centered in distal CA1 and the prosubiculum of the genu (Fig. 3A). (p. 98)

" For example, in case MOL-L, an injection of 35 [micro] Ci of tritiated amino acids was centered in the subiculum of the posterior body of the HF, just caudal to the injection site in case BMV-R. " (p. 101)
" In case MPG-R, an injection of 15 [micro] Ci of tritiated amino acids was centered in CA1 of the midbody of the HF (see Figs. 3A, 5A) ." (p. 99)

" In case PDA-L, an injection of approximately 15 [micro] Ci of tritiated amino acids was centered in rostral CA1 in the lateral part of the genu and anterior body, as illustrated in Figures 3A and 4A." (p. 97)
